glossary.title: Abbreviations
glossary.p: Serotonin 1A receptor, 5-HT 1A; Integrated Spectral Database System of Organic Compounds, AIST; analysis of variance, ANOVA; area under the curve, AUC; cannabinoid receptor subtype 2, CB2; central nervous system, CNS; carbon dioxide, CO 2; correlation spectroscopy, COSY; cyclooxygenase, COX; electron volt, eV; flumazenil, FMZ; gas chromatography, GC; heteronuclear multiple-bond correlation spectroscopy, HMBC; heteronuclear single-quantum correlation spectroscopy, HSQC; median lethal dose, LD 50; l-arginine methyl ester, L-NAME; mitogen-activated protein kinase, MAPK; metamizole, MET; megahertz, MHz; mass spectrometry, MS; not identified, n.i.; nuclear factor kappa-light-chain-enhancer of activated B-cells, NF-κB; National Institute of Standards and Technology, NIST; naloxone, NLX; nuclear magnetic resonance, NMR; non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug, NSAID; Organization for Economic Co-operation and Development, OECD; prostaglandin E 2, PGE 2, retention index, RI; retention time, RT; sodium pentobarbital, SP; Tagetes lucida essential oil, TLEO; tumor necrosis factor alpha, TNF-α; vehicle, VEH; WAY100635, WAY.
